title: Remove the photo montage and all user photos from the Valentine experience

requirements.text: Remove the “Memories” photo montage scene from the Valentine site so no user photos are shown anywhere in the UI.
acceptanceCriteria: The app no longer renders or links to the Memories montage scene in any flow/state.
No photo images from `/assets/memories/*` are referenced by any React component at runtime.
The Valentine experience still includes the initial letter scene, the Yes/No outcome scenes, and the proposal scene.

requirements.text: Update the Valentine flow so that the “Yes” outcome’s Continue action transitions directly to the proposal scene (skipping any photo/memories step).
acceptanceCriteria: Clicking “Yes” then “Continue” takes the user to the proposal scene.
No intermediate scene/state named “memories” remains in the flow logic.
Keyboard navigation or UI controls previously used for the montage are no longer available in production builds.

requirements.text: Remove montage-specific code and styling that is no longer used after deleting the photo montage (component, imports, and montage CSS rules), ensuring the app builds cleanly with no unused-scene references.
acceptanceCriteria: `MemoriesMontageScene` is no longer imported or referenced by `ValentineInvitePage`.
Montage-related CSS selectors (e.g., `.montage-*`) are removed if they are no longer used anywhere else.
The project builds without TypeScript errors related to the removed montage feature.

constraints: Do not edit files under frontend/immutablePaths (e.g., Internet Identity hooks and ui components).
Keep the existing romantic theme, letter content, cinematic effects (film grain/vignette), and proposal flow intact.
nonGoals: Adding new photos or replacing the montage with another gallery experience.
Fixing the earlier issue of an uploaded photo not being visible (this change intentionally removes photos entirely).
Adding background music (not requested in this change).
